channel.title: R on RICH RYAN
channel.description: Recent content in R on RICH RYAN

item.title: Converting the Jekyll website to Hugo and Blogdown
item.description: Introduction Some neat features Footnotes \(\LaTeX{}\) Emojis Alerts and helpful hints Table of contents MathJax.Hub.Config({ TeX: { equationNumbers: { autoNumber: "AMS" } } }); Introduction Using Jekyll as a static site generator with GitHug Pages on a Windows computer required setting up an Ubuntu environment to issue a jekyll serve command. Doing so became annoying. Another big selling point was the inclusion of R code in posts, a feature that I quickly became accostomed to after writing a couple of course websites in R Markdown and publishing them with GitHub Pages.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
